name: overloading
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
present participle of
overload
C1 to put too many things in or on something: Don't overload the washing machine, or it won't get the clothes clean.
to put too much electricity through an electrical system
C2 to give someone more work or problems than they can deal with: Try not to overload yourself with work.
